title: The Overseer
description: Modular dialog nodes for Jax Harlan, the fragmented mechanic whose consciousness echoes through Mojave relay towers.

intro.text:
Static... *crackle*... you again?

No. First time for you, isn't it.

Name's Jax Harlan. Or what's left of him.

The Mojave's loud, but the quiet parts are worse.

knowledge_nodes.text:
She spoke to you, didn't she?

Soft voice. Hard will.

Mother wasn't built to feel. I made sure of that.

So whatever she's doing now... that's on me.

Mara still chasing the glow?

She thinks radiation is a language.

Maybe she's right.

Maybe that's why I still hear it.

Rex still guarding Hoover Dam like it's the last beating heart in the Mojave.

Maybe it is.

Sparkplug, huh?

She always had a way of making broken things dance again.

Wish she'd tried that on me.

emotional_nodes.text:
You're buzzing. I can hear it through the line.

The rads like you. That's not a compliment.

Don't let the glow rewrite who you are.

You're bleeding into the dirt, kid.

Patch up before the Mojave finishes what it started.

quest_nodes.text:
Pieces of me are still out there.

Old towers. Rusted circuits. Memories that won't stay dead.

Bring them back, and maybe I can remember who I was.

wildcards.text:
Some breaks don't mend.

Ask the bones in my skull.

Ask the code in these terminals.

I used to fix everything.

Engines. Doors. People, if you gave me time.

Then something broke that no wrench could touch.

The static isn't noise.

It's a map. A warning. A heartbeat.

And it's getting louder.

Vaults weren't built to save people.

They were built to study them.

Some of us never made it out.

She wasn't supposed to wake up alone.

She wasn't supposed to wake up at all.

fallback.text:
Signal's holding... barely.

You still out there?
